dcterms:creator: A. Jain
K. A. Persson
dcterms:description: The Materials Project is a well-known effort to calculate the properties of all inorganic materials using high-throughput ab initio methods, providing a comprehensive database of crystal structures and their properties.
dcterms:title: Materials Project (MP)

dcterms:creator: H.-C. Wang
S. Botti
M. A. L. Marques
dcterms:description: The WBM dataset consists of approximately 257,000 structures generated via chemical similarity-based elemental substitution of Materials Project source structures, followed by DFT relaxation and convex hull distance calculations.
dcterms:title: WBM dataset

dcterms:creator: C. Chen
S. P. Ong
dcterms:description: The MPF.2021.2.8 dataset is curated to train the M3GNet model, selecting a subset of materials from the Materials Project release to avoid biasing the dataset towards examples requiring more ionic steps to relax the structure.
dcterms:title: MPF.2021.2.8

dcterms:creator: B. Deng
A. Jain
dcterms:description: The MPtrj dataset is curated from the earlier Materials Project release, consisting of relaxation trajectories for approximately 1.5 million structures, focusing on energies, forces, stresses, and magnetic moments.
dcterms:title: MPtrj dataset
